intro: Parietaria judaica subsp. judaica, commonly known as Jewish wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of about 10–30 cm. The plant features heart-shaped, hairy leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found growing on walls or in dry, sunny areas. The species is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
